title: Constrained DKL to Accelerate Structure-Property Relationship Discovery in Automated Electron and Scanning Probe Microscopy
content: Machine learning (ML) has precipitated a significant acceleration in scientific research, particularly within the realm of microscopy. The acquisition of spectral data, conventionally performed on a grid, poses a question: Can we intelligently select points to converge on the desired property more efficiently? In this study, we present a constrained deep kernel learning (DKL) approach to optimize spectral data acquisition (Fig. 1) for exploring structure-property relationship.
